-e ---

𓃾 𓄀 𓃒 𓃓 𓃽 𒋫 alpha
𔒃 𔑺 𔑾 𔒀 𔑼 𔒁 𔑻 Vieh 𔑿 Muh 𓏠 𓈖 𓃒
𔒄 ka/ga cow/gaw heifer 𓃖
𔑺 bull bock ⇔ cephal
󲁡

α 𜦾 𜧟 ≈ opposing 𓃾 𓃒 in bull fight image

𓃾 contributed to the first letter of the modern alphabet:

𓇋 𓎛 𓃾 | bull | 𒀖 arhu, ox, Vieh, Fiecher < box, bos, baca 𒀖
𓇋 𓎛 𓏏 𓃒 | cow | oX-Tier/Taur
𓇋 𓎛 𓅱 𓉐 | stable (for animals) | Ehren-tor ⋍ Erker-/ oXen-Tor
𓇋 𓎛 𓅱 𓏏 𓏤 𓏤 𓀀 | cultivator | √acre[tor/tan] ackerus -

𓇋 𓎛 𓃾 | bull | 𒀖 arhu < •parhu פָּרָה pará بقرة bagara
𓇋 𓎛 𓃾 | bull | 𒀖 arhu < গরু gôru গোরু goru गोरूप gorūpa, “cattle-like” кра́ва kráva

alpha al’Pha PⲀ (das Vieh ᚠ)

𓇋 𓎛 𓃾 | bull | al’Pha α
𓇋 𓎛 𓃾 | bull | 𓎛 ≈ 𒁍 púʳ par פר bull in 𒀠𒁍 al-pu 𓃾 α
𓇋 𓎛 𓃾 | bull | 𓃾 ≈ 𓄋 𓊪 𓏲

The old reading of Ⲁ was probably not ‘a’, but ‘pha’ =: ƥ ⇔ ʔ

Compare with the egyptian «A'pi» bull.

𓃒𓃓𓃾𓄀𓃿

https://ancient-hebrew.org/dictionary/ancient-aleph.html

𒀉𒄞 a₂gud "ox"
